p: Glycated haemoglobin (HbA1c) is a useful test that plays a central role in the diagnosis, prevention, and monitoring of diabetes. The benefit of glycated haemoglobin testing is that it does not vary noticeably with time and can therefore be done at any time of the day and also provides better reproducibility than glucose testing. HbAc1 testing provides instant results that are very important for therapeutic purpose and also for lifestyle interventions and improve overall diabetes care and control [ 7]. The American Diabetes Federation uses an HbA1c value greater than 6.5% as a definite diagnosis of diabetes mellitus [ 8]. Furthermore, HbA1c levels between 5.7% and 6.4% correspond to people with pre-diabetes who are at higher risk of developing DM.
